span.style: background: aqua; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19, Littlefield ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations until Monday, May 4th in an effort to support our nations need to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, or COVID-19. Our health officials report that cases are continuing to spread in the state, and an increase in confirmed cases in our county seems likely. Suspending operations for this length of time will allow us to determine, in coordination with local health officials, whether the virus is continuing to have community spread or whether it has been contained.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has outlined the need for all communities to implement a social distancing protocol. We want to reiterate a request to our broader community to take the following reasonable precautions to prevent the spread of the illness:

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: Limit movement within the community, especially avoiding crowded placed and maintaining 6 ft of distance between people

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: If you are moving around in the community, dont congregate in large groups

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: For those who have traveled to areas with known COVID-19 cases both inside and outside of the country we ask that you self-quarantine and monitor for symptoms. Students who have traveled should plan to stay home for two weeks after arriving home.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol;
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 99, 193);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 99, 193);

p.span: of COVID-19, call your health care provider for medical advice .

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: Keep your child at home if he/she feels ill, even if you think it is just a cold.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Cambria, serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Symbol; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);
font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; font-family: "Times New Roman";
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: Do not leave the house if you are ill, except to access medical care.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: Meal Distribution will continue under the current plan and at the same sites that have been in operation on all weekdays with the exception of Friday, April 10th and Monday, April 13th. Those days are official school holidays, and there will be no meal distribution on those days.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: Instructional Materials will be exchanged (drop off of completed assignments and pick up new assignments) on April 6th, April 20th, and May 4th (if school closure is extended). In other words, Instructional Material exchange will now take place once every two weeks. When possible, submit completed assignments to your teachers by email or other electronic means. Please note the

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
letter-spacing: -0.25pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: tab on the main page. Teacher email addresses along with detailed guidance on submitting assignments electronically are located here. Do not hesitate emailing your teachers to ask for help. Please check the

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
letter-spacing: -0.25pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

p.span: Please visit your Campus Facebook page for any other details.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: This continues to be a rapidly changing situation, and we will continue to monitor information, assess conditions on a daily basis, and provide information updates on our

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: and Littlefield ISD Facebook page. Instructions specific to your childs campus may be found on the respective Campus Facebook page.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(90, 0, 2);

p.span: Thank you for your support and cooperation as we ensure that all members of the Littlefield ISD community stay safe and healthy.

span.a: Click here for updated Food Service Letter

caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 14px; text-size-adjust: auto; font-family: Helvetica;
span.strong: The UIL released the following information:

br.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 14px; text-size-adjust: auto;

p.style: font-family: Helvetica; text-align: justify;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-family: "Segoe UI"; font-size: 16px;

p.span: Please know that we realize you are looking for clarity in this uncertain time. Unfortunately, we simply do not have enough information at this moment to provide you with a detailed plan for moving forward with UIL activities. As soon as we have more information on when schools will resume operations, we will quickly respond with a detailed plan for resuming UIL competitions. At this point, we are committed to completing all of our competitive seasons that have not yet been completed.

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-family: "Segoe UI"; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(32, 31, 30);

p.span: While the immediate future is unclear, we will continue to develop contingency plans and prepare for all possible outcomes, including extended school closures.

p.style: font-family: Helvetica; text-align: justify;

span.style: padding: 0in; border: 1pt none windowtext; font-family: "Segoe UI"; font-size: 16px;

p.span: We have previously communicated that all UIL activities are suspended until March 30th. Given information related to school closures available at this time, we are extending that timeframe. UIL games and contests will resume no earlier than Monday, May 4th. Prior to that date, to allow students and schools to reenter competition,UIL will provide a reasonable acclimatization period for rehearsals and practices to occur, consistent with the advice of local, state and federal officials.We will reevaluate the beginning dates for practices and rehearsals as we receive more information about schools resuming.

p.style: text-align: left;
text-align: justify;

div.p: Littlefield Independent School District is closely monitoring the situation and is making the necessary preparations in case the COVID-19 becomes more prevalent in our community. For now, there have been no indications of a coronavirus outbreak in LISD, but we must be prepared for that possibility.

p.style: text-align: justify;

div.p: We all play a role in reducing the likelihood of a coronavirus outbreak in our school district community. We encourage everyone to practice good habits, including:

p.style: text-align: justify;

div.p: Wash your hands regularly, especially after using the restroom and before preparing or consuming food. Wash for 20 seconds, using soap and hot water. Be sure to also wash your fingertips.

p.style: text-align: justify;

div.p: Avoid coughing or sneezing into your hands or in the air. Always try to cough or sneeze into a tissue, and then throw the tissue away. If you dont have a tissue, cough/sneeze into the crook of your arm.

p.style: text-align: justify;

div.p: As much as you can, avoid touching your eyes, mouth and nose.

p.style: text-align: justify;

div.p: If children are feeling sick, please keep them home from school. Allow them adequate time to recover before returning to school. This will help to insure that children are ready to participate fully in all instructional activities. This practice can also reduce the risk of the spreading of any infection.

p.style: text-align: justify;

div.p: We will continue to communicate with you in the days and weeks to come. It is possible that we may need to cancel classes in the future if it appears the coronavirus has affected our community in a significant way.

p.style: text-align: justify;

div.p: As always, the safety of our students, staff and families remains our top priority. We will act with an abundance of caution to protect everyones health and well-being!

p.style: text-align: justify;
